response.overview: After his acclaimed literary adaptations of “Carmen” and “Peer Gynt,” Johan Inger is turning his attention to a subject that is a ballet classic of the performance canon and another facet of the choreographer: “Swan Lake.” For the Semperoper Ballet, the Swedish choreographer will undertake another reinterpretation in 2023 that addresses profound questions: What influence do violence and manipulation have on interpersonal relationships? What role do personal freedom, respect and acceptance play in a love relationship?
response.title: A Swan Lake
